raw_text:
Aviator wins top Globes accolades
 
 The Aviator has been named best film at the Golden Globe Awards, with its star Leonardo DiCaprio named best actor.
 
 Hollywood veteran Clint Eastwood took the best director prize for Million Dollar Baby while its star Hilary Swank was best actress. Quirky comedy Sideways was named best screenplay and best comedy. Ray star Jamie Foxx was best actor in a musical/comedy while Briton Clive Owen and Natalie Portman won prizes for best supporting roles in Closer.
 
 The Aviator, in which DiCaprio plays millionaire Howard Hughes, edged ahead of its rivals at the Beverly Hills ceremony by winning the best original score prize. This give it a total of three awards while Million Dollar Baby, Sideways and Closer took two Golden Globes each. Accepting his best dramatic actor prize, DiCaprio described director Martin Scorsese as "one of the greatest contributors to the world of cinema of all time".
 
 Annette Bening won best actress in a musical/comedy for Being Julia while Spanish movie The Sea Inside was named best foreign language film. Swank, who previously won the Golden Globe and Oscar for Boys Don't Cry, paid tribute to Million Dollar Baby director and co-star Clint Eastwood. "You guided us so brilliantly, while you also, in my humble opinion, gave the performance of your career," she said. Foxx was nominated for three awards but was beaten to the best supporting actor title by Owen and the best actor in a TV movie prize by Geoffrey Rush in The Life and Death of Peter Sellers.
 
 A BBC co-production, The Life and Death of Peter Sellers was also named best TV movie. Mick Jagger and Dave Stewart won the best original song award for Old Habits Die Hard from movie re-make Alfie, while Ian McShane was named best actor in a TV drama for his lead role in Deadwood.
 
 Other UK hopes Kate Winslet and Imelda Staunton went home empty-handed despite lead actress nominations for Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and Vera Drake respectively. Winning a Golden Globe is said to improve a film or performer's chance of subsequently winning an Academy Award. Unlike the Oscars, the Golden Globes split awards by genre - one prize for dramas and the other for musicals and comedies. The Globes also honour the best in television, with suburban series Desperate Housewives named best TV comedy show. Actress Teri Hatcher beat fellow Desperate Housewives stars Marcia Cross and Felicity Huffman to the best comedy actress prize.
 
 Hatcher thanked the show's cast, crew and "a network who gave me a second chance at a career when I couldn't have been a bigger 'has been'". Cosmetic surgery series Nip/Tuck beat The Sopranos and Deadwood to the best television drama title. Arrested Development star Jason Bateman was named best TV actor in a musical or comedy series. The Golden Globes are awarded by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association, comprising film reporters based in Los Angeles and working for overseas outlets. Robin Williams, a five-time Globe winner for such films as The Fisher King and Good Morning, Vietnam, received the Cecil B DeMille award for career achievement. He dedicated his prize to Superman actor Christopher Reeve, who died last year.
llama3.2:1b:
The Aviator won best film, Leonardo DiCaprio won best actor, Clint Eastwood won best director, Hilary Swank won best actress, and Jamie Foxx won best actor in a musical/comedy.

DiCaprio described Scorsese as "one of the greatest contributors to the world of cinema". Bening won for Being Julia, Swank won for Boys Don't Cry, and Foxx was nominated but beaten by Owen for The Life and Death of Peter Sellers.

The Life and Death of Peter Sellers was named best TV movie. Mick Jagger and Dave Stewart won for Alfie, and Ian McShane won for Deadwood.
llama3.2:3b: The Aviator won top prizes at the Golden Globe Awards, with Leonardo DiCaprio named best actor and Martin Scorsese winning best director. Clint Eastwood took home two awards for Million Dollar Baby, while Sideways won two and Closer also secured two. Other winners included Jamie Foxx, Briton Clive Owen and Natalie Portman in supporting roles, Annette Bening for Being Julia and The Sea Inside as best foreign language film.
gemma2:2b:
The Aviator won best film at the Golden Globes, with Leonardo DiCaprio winning best actor.  Clint Eastwood won best director for Million Dollar Baby and Hilary Swank won best actress. Sideways won best screenplay and comedy.  Jamie Foxx won best actor in a musical/comedy and Clive Owen and Natalie Portman won best supporting roles in Closer. The Aviator also won the best original score award. 
Other winners include Annette Bening for Being Julia (best actress in a musical/comedy),  The Sea Inside for best foreign language film, and Ian McShane for best actor in a TV drama for Deadwood.  Desperate Housewives won best television comedy show, while Teri Hatcher won best comedy actress. Nip/Tuck won best television drama. Jason Bateman won best TV actor in a musical or comedy series. 
The Cecil B DeMille award was given to Robin Williams.
qwen2.5:0.5b:
Key points from the text:

  * Leonardo DiCaprio won best film at the Golden Globe Awards with Million Dollar Baby.
  * Hilary Swank won best actress at the Golden Globe Awards for Sideways.
  * Clive Owen and Natalie Portman won three Golden Globes each, with Jamie Foxx winning best actor in a musical/comedy for The Life and Death of Peter Sellers.
  * Sideways was named best screenplay, best comedy, and best drama while Millennium won best film at the Golden Globe Awards for Boys Don't Cry.
qwen2.5:1.5b: The Aviator wins top Golden Globe awards, including best film director Clint Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby. Leonardo DiCaprio of The Aviator secures multiple nominations and victories. Actress Imelda Staunton of Desperate Housewives misses out on the award for acting categories despite strong performances.
qwen2.5:3b: The Aviator won best film at Golden Globes with Leonardo DiCaprio taking best actor. Million Dollar Baby director Clint Eastwood was best director. Sideways and Closer each took two awards. The Aviator's original score win gave it three Golden Globe wins. Best actress went to Hilary Swank for Million Dollar Baby, while Jamie Foxx won best actor in a musical/comedy and Clive Owen won supporting actress. Best screenplay for Sideways, best comedy for Sideways, and best supporting actress for Natalie Portman also awarded to Closer. Annette Bening won best actress in a musical or comedy, and The Sea Inside was named best foreign language film. Ray's Jamie Foxx won best actor in a musical/comedy, while Geoffrey Rush won the best supporting actor award from TV series. Nick Hornby's Being Julia took best actress in a musical/comedy. Desperate Housewives was named best TV comedy show with Teri Hatcher winning best comedy actress. Nip/Tat received best original song for Old Habits Die Hard. Ian McShane earned best actor in a TV drama for Deadwood. Kate Winslet and Imelda Staunton were nominated but missed out on awards. The Golden Globes split awards by genre, honoring the best in television as well. Robin Williams was awarded the Cecil B DeMille Award for career achievement.

The Hollywood veteran Clint Eastwood took the Best Screenplay award and Best Comedy prize for Sideways. Ray actor Jamie Foxx won Best Supporting Actor in a Musical/Comedy, while Briton Clive Owen and Natalie Portman were named Best Supporting Actresses in Close. The Aviator, which also won Best Original Score and Best Foreign Language Film, edges out the competition with three awards and wins Best Original Screenplay, Best TV Drama, and Best TV Comedy Show for Desperate Housewives. Annette Bening, who previously won a Golden Globe for Being Julia, pays tribute to Million Dolar Baby director Clint Eastwood in the Best Actress in a Musical/Comedy category. Her co-star and fellow nominee Natalie Portman also took home a Globe award for her performance in Close. Other UK hopes include Kate Winshall, winner of a Golden Globe for Verda Drake (Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind), which leads to a chance of eventually winning an Academy Award for best picture. The Globe awards also honour the best in television and suburban series Despereate Housewives won Best TV Comedy Show, with actress Teri Hatcher beating fellow show's stars Marc Cross and Felicity Huxtable to win Best Actress in a TV Drama Series.
tinydolphin:1.1b: A British film named "The Aviator" won a record-breaking four Golden Globe Awards and five other accolades at the 2010 ceremony, including Best Film (Drama), Best Director, Best Actor for Leonardo DiCaprio, and Best Screenplay. The film also earned Clint Eastwood his first-ever Golden Globe Award as best director for "Million Dollar Baby." In addition to these awards, the film received nominations in four other categories: Best Original Score (Drama), Best Actress (Hilary Swank) and Best Supporting Actor (Clive Owen). The film's star Leonardo DiCaprio also won the Golden Globe Award for Best Actor in a Drama, while Hilary Swank's role as a leading female character was recognized by receiving a nomination for Best Actress in a Musical/Comedy.

reference: The Aviator has been named best film at the Golden Globe Awards, with its star Leonardo DiCaprio named best actor.Hollywood veteran Clint Eastwood took the best director prize for Million Dollar Baby while its star Hilary Swank was best actress.Foxx was nominated for three awards but was beaten to the best supporting actor title by Owen and the best actor in a TV movie prize by Geoffrey Rush in The Life and Death of Peter Sellers.The Globes also honour the best in television, with suburban series Desperate Housewives named best TV comedy show.Quirky comedy Sideways was named best screenplay and best comedy.Annette Bening won best actress in a musical/comedy for Being Julia while Spanish movie The Sea Inside was named best foreign language film.Ray star Jamie Foxx was best actor in a musical/comedy while Briton Clive Owen and Natalie Portman won prizes for best supporting roles in Closer.Mick Jagger and Dave Stewart won the best original song award for Old Habits Die Hard from movie re-make Alfie, while Ian McShane was named best actor in a TV drama for his lead role in Deadwood.Arrested Development star Jason Bateman was named best TV actor in a musical or comedy series.A BBC co-production, The Life and Death of Peter Sellers was also named best TV movie.
